alert.note: Alert for Carter (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 26 at 4:09PM MDT until May 26 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Billings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Carter County in southeastern Montana... * Until 515 PM MDT. * At 408 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 14 miles north of Lightning Flat, or 26 miles southeast of Broadus, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Half dollar size hail and torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * Locations impacted include... Boyes, Hammond and Ridge. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
